description: Coined based on Latin suggestus, perfect passive participle of suggerō (“I carry or bring under, furnish, supply, excite, advise, suggest”), from sub (“under”) + gerō (“I bear, carry”).

verbs.description: suggest (third-person singular simple present suggests, present participle suggesting, simple past and past participle suggested)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To imply but stop short of explicitly stating (something).
examples: Are you suggesting that I killed my wife?

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause one to suppose (something); to bring to one's mind the idea (of something).
examples: Some ideas  […]  are suggested to the mind by all the ways of sensation and reflection.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To explicitly mention (something) as a possibility for consideration, often to recommend it
examples: He suggests that we celebrate with dinner at Bellissimo. He suggests our celebrating with dinner at Bellissimo.
The guidebook suggests that we visit the local cathedral, which is apparently beautiful.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To seduce; to prompt to evil; to tempt.
